newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Int'l Bank of Asia closes FRCD.
newsitem.headline: Int'l Bank of Asia closes FRCD.

text.p: International Bank of Asia's floating rate certificate of deposit issue has been allotted, arranger Fuji International said.
The facility has two tranches. Tranche A is HK$620 million. Tranche B is US$56 million.
Both tranches have a final maturity of three years and were priced at par.
Tranche A pays a coupon of 50 basis points over the three-month Hong Kong Interbank Offered Rate. With fees, the all-in return for top-tier managers is 72 basis points.
Tranche B pays a coupon of 40 basis points over the three-month London Interbank Offered Rate. With fees, the all-in return for top-tier managers is 57 basis points.
A total of eight banks joined tranche A.
Arrangers and lead managers with HK$85 million each, are Bayerische Landesbank, Fuji International Finance, Sakura Finance Asia, Standard Chartered Bank, WestLB, and Westpac Banking Corp.
Co-lead manager Dresdner Bank committed HK$80 million.
Manager PT Bank Pembangunan Indonesia Hong Kong committed HK$30 million.
A total of 11 banks joined tranche B.
Co-lead managers Arab Banking Corp with US$10 million, Bank of Austria Aktiengesellschaft with US$8 million.
Senior managers GiroCredit Bank with US$7 million, other senior managers with US$5 million each are Arab Bank Offshore Banking Unit, Bank of New York Hong Kong, and Commercial Bank of Kuwait.

Manager Gulf International Bank committed US$4 million. Other managers with US$3 million each, are Banca di Roma SpA, Banca Nazionale del Lavoro, Banco di Napoli S.p.A and Landesbank Rheinland-Pfalz Girozentrale.
